Description: Body sherd of early Chian patterned pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired brown and mostly worn) with two added white lines near bottom of sherd; exterior: reserved save for single brown band at turn to cul near bottom of sherd; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces of the sherd make it difficult to determine to what style it belongs. Early patterned chalices have no decoration on either side of the chalice walls.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 30)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0334) (phase 2)
